subject: Fashion
title: The Great Male Renunciation
description: A 60-second lesson on The Great Male Renunciation.

hook.text: Before 1800, rich men dressed like peacocksâ€”silk, lace, embroidery, and bright colors everywhere.

buildup.text: Then the French Revolution made flashy clothing dangerous. Looking rich could get you killed.

discovery.text: Psychologist J.C. FlÃ¼gel named this shift 'The Great Male Renunciation' of decorative dressing.

twist.text: Men didn't just lose color. They lost the right to be visually expressive without being mocked.

climax.text: For 200 years, the dark suit became men's uniform. An entire gender traded beauty for 'seriousness.'

punchline.text: Men gave up color. They haven't fully reclaimed it.

quiz.question: What triggered 'The Great Male Renunciation' in men's fashion?
options: The French Revolution made flashy aristocratic clothing dangerous
The invention of the sewing machine made simple clothing cheaper
Queen Victoria's husband popularized plain dark suits
